author: simon johnson
title: Arsene Wenger to sit among Chelsea fans at Stamford Bridge with Gunners security staff seated around him
text:
Thursday 2 February 2017 12:56 BST Click to followES Sport Touchline ban: Wenger will watch from the stands as he serves the third of a four-game ban Getty Images 
Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger will be sitting among Chelsea supporters during the London derby at Stamford Bridge on Saturday. 
Wenger was handed a four-game touchline ban by the Football Association for pushing fourth official Anthony Taylor during the match against Burnley last month. 
This will be the third game of his suspension, but he will not watch the match from the directorsâ€™ box as it is on the other side of the ground. 
Wenger is permitted to give a team talk before the game and at half-time, as well as having to fulfil media obligations, but it will be too difficult for him to do if sat in the West Stand. Redknapp: Arsenal lack mental strength so Wenger should keep quiet 
Negotiations between the two clubs have been taking place over the past few days to come to a resolution and Wenger will be sat in the middle tier of the East Stand, which is the side of the ground where the dressing rooms are situated. 
It is believed Chelsea have already been putting arrangements in place for stewarding to escort the Arsenal manager to and from his seat. 
The Gunners will also be bringing their own security personnel to ensure everything goes smoothly. They will sit around him during the match to act as a precautionary buffer from the home fans. 
Meanwhile, the Blues have been handed cause for concern ahead of the title run-in with the news that Eden Hazard has joined David Luiz in picking up an injury. 
Luiz has been playing through the pain barrier with a knee problem for the past two months and Standard Sport understands that Belgium international Hazard suffered a knock against Leicester last month that has been affecting his performances. Read more
